doc:
Bob Kortman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Kortman 0 Robert F. Kortman (December 24, 1887 – March 13, 1967) was an American film actor mostly associated with westerns, though he also appeared in a number of Laurel and Hardy comedies. He appeared in more than 260 films between 1914 and 1952. The son of a rancher, Kortman was born in Brackettville, Texas. He spent six years in the U.S. cavalry.Director Tom Ince cast Kortman as a villain when he began working in films in 1911, and he went on to become the "favored on-screen opponent" for William S. Hart with regard to their film fights.Kortman died in Long Beach, California from cancer. Robert_F._Kortman ( December_24_,_1887 – March_13_,_1967 ) was an_American_film_actor mostly associated with westerns , though he also appeared in a_number of Laurel_and_Hardy_comedies . He appeared in more_than_260_films between 1914_and_1952 . The_son of a_rancher , Kortman was_born in Brackettville , Texas . He spent six_years in the_U.S._cavalry.Director_Tom_Ince cast Kortman as a_villain when he began_working in films in 1911 , and he went on to_become the_"_favored_on-screen_opponent " for William_S._Hart with regard to their_film_fights.Kortman died in Long_Beach , California from cancer .
